text:
India on Wednesday said that a peaceful and secure neighbourhood would yield “rich dividends” for SAARC countries even as it asserted that the time had come to take stock of the past decisions of the grouping on which there had been no movement. In his statement during the 42nd SAARC Standing Committee Meeting here, Foreign Secretary S. Jaishankar said India was pursuing with vigour its “neighbourhood first” policy.

He noted that the grouping had some useful agreements in the area of security, including the Convention on Terrorism, Narcotic Drugs and on Human Trafficking. However, circulation of fake currency remained a challenge, he said. — PTI
title: India says safe neighbourhood will benefit all
